intro: Urostigma cyclophyllum, commonly known as the cyclophyll cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its flowers, which are often yellow or orange, bloom during the warmer months and attract various pollinators. Urostigma cyclophyllum is also valued for its resilience and is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
